summary: This document is a summary of account balances and transactions for Jeffrey Epstein's account at Deutsche Bank for the month of October 2016. It details various outgoing transfers to different banks and companies, as well as the account's balance at the beginning and end of the month.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the account holder at Deutsche Bank, and the document details his account transactions and balances for October 2016.

events.title: Account Summary for October 2016
events.description: Summary of account balances and transactions for Jeffrey Epstein's account at Deutsche Bank.

events.title: Outgoing Transfers
events.description: Multiple outgoing money transfers from Epstein's account to various banks and companies.

events.title: Credit Memo
events.description: A credit memo was issued for a return of a wire transfer due to an invalid account.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter, St. Thomas, USVI 00802
keyFacts: The document details Jeffrey Epstein's account balance at the beginning and end of October 2016.
There were multiple outgoing transfers from Epstein's account to various banks and companies, including Wells Fargo and JPMorgan Chase.
A credit memo was issued on October 28, 2016, for a wire transfer that was returned due to an invalid account.
The account had a beginning balance of $175,018.57 and an ending balance of $123,892.62.
The document includes specific transaction details, including dates and amounts for outgoing transfers.
